feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Flood Watch issued October 18 at 9:42AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH THURSDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...The following areas, Prince of Wales and Southern Inner Channels. This includes the cities of Craig, Klawock, Hydaburg, Coffman Cove, Thorne Bay, Ketchikan, And Metlakatla.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Annette Island; Ketchikan Gateway Borough; Prince of Wales Island

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued October 18 at 7:35AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 AM AKDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Near The Ward Lake Recreational Area. * WHEN...Until 730 AM AKDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Ketchikan Gateway Borough

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 18 at 4:27AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Periods of Snow and Blowing Snow Thursday and Thursday Night... Snowfall and gusty winds between 20 and 30 mph will develop Thursday morning and persist into Thursday night, resulting in localized areas of blowing snow, especially over summits of the Dalton and Steese highways. Snowfall accumulations of 1 to 2 inches can be expected. Conditions are expected to improve Friday
entry.cap:areaDesc: Chatanika River Valley; Dalton Highway Summits; Upper Chena River Valley; White Mountains and High Terrain South of the Yukon River; Yukon Flats

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 18 at 4:26AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Elevated Surf Expected Tonight Through Friday... Elevated surf is expected along the western Arctic coast from near Point Hope to Wainwright. North to northwesterly winds will increase today to 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 45 mph. Strong winds will cause elevated surf for coastal areas. Winds will gradually decrease Friday. Wave action may cause minor erosion.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Northwest Arctic Coast; Western Arctic Coast

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 18 at 4:25AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Elevated Surf Expected Through Friday... Elevated surf is expected along the Chukchi Sea coast, including Kotzebue Sound and north-facing coasts of the Seward Peninsula. North to northwesterly winds will increase today to 30 to 40 mph. Strong winds will cause elevated surf for coastal areas of the Chukchi Sea. Winds will gradually decrease Friday. Wave action may
entry.cap:areaDesc: Baldwin Peninsula; Kivalina and Red Dog Dock; Lower Kobuk Valley; Noatak Valley; Northern Seward Peninsula; Shishmaref

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 17 at 10:09AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...RESUSPENDED ASH FROM KATMAI-NOVARUPTA EXPECTED OVER KODIAK ISLAND TONIGHT THROUGH LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT... Strong northwesterly winds (up to 40 mph) will develop this afternoon and persist through late Wednesday night. There is a high chance (75-85%) that these winds will resuspend ash from the 1912 Katmai- Novarupta eruption. The villages of Karluk, Akhiok
entry.cap:areaDesc: Kodiak Island

entry.title: Flood Warning issued October 18 at 10:03AM EDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Astor affecting Lake and Volusia Counties. .The Saint Johns River near Astor is forecast to remain on the cusp of Minor and Moderate flood stage through tonight, then a slow fall back through Minor flood stage is forecast through the weekend. entry.cap:areaDesc: Lake; Volusia
